author: realbigsean
content:
dunno if anyone else has run into this but it seems like the kiln relay is using mainnet genesis fork version for signature verification?

I'm doing testing and a mainnet fork version  (`0x00000000`)  is accepted but the kiln fork version (`0x70000069`) is rejected

author: realbigsean
content:
It also seems like duplicate valid messages aren't accepted, the second returns: `{"code":400,"message":"invalid timestamp"}`

I was under the impression registrations needed to be re-signed infrequently, and the once per epoch registration we are sending would be a duplicate.

author: ruteri
content:
Builder API messages should be signed using `compute_domain(DOMAIN_APPLICATION_BUILDER)` which doesn't use the fork version (it's `0x00000000`)
Spec in case the implementation of the relay is incorrect https://github.com/ethereum/builder-specs/blob/e912fa8c6727fa456106cc85cb94fc4ab0f8d251/specs/builder.md#signing

author: ruteri
content:
As per spec the same timestamp should error https://github.com/ethereum/builder-specs/blob/e602513bd5be4b8f0cc799af2c25e95049c2036e/apis/builder/validators.yaml#L9
If you think this is incorrect do create an issue in the builder spec!
